description:
You're about to learn how to: Grow resilient teams by managing meetings of excellence to meet your goals. In this course, you'll get 36 practical tools that you can take away and use tomorrow before, during and after your team meetings to move forward towards your goals. Ask yourself:

Have you ever had any of these concerns?

  1. “I don't see how this meeting is relevant to me."
  2. “I have other things on my mind."
  3. “This is not high priority for me."
  4. “I don't think the meetings have a good structure."
  5. “I really don't like one of my team members."
  6. “The meetings are a waste of time."
  7. “They never finish when they're supposed to."
  8. “We never follow up on action items."
  9. “There are no action items assigned."
  10. “We didn't get anywhere."
  11. “The same topics keep coming up over and over again."
  12. “There's always negative people that have nothing to contribute."
  13. “We talk about the same thing over and over again."

What If You Could Do The Following?

  1. Enjoy being with your coworkers.
  2. Get your ideas validated and recognized.
  3. Get more help and support when you need it.
  4. Get genuine praise for your accomplishments.
  5. Achieve your organizational and individual goals.
  6. Take on additional responsibility.
  7. Show off your individual skills and abilities.
  8. Incorporate your personal goals into those of the team.
  9. Consolidate communication.
  10. Prioritize your work.
  11. Expedite decision making.
  12. More effectively use your time.
  13. Make better decisions as a team.
  14. Get validation on the work you've used your time on.


Don't take our word for it. Listen to what others have to say:

“As a presenter, trainer and business professional, I have conducted more than 750 webinars over the last 8 years. During that time, I have constantly searched for programs to help me increase my presentation skills, get people involved in my meetings, and dazzle my participants. For the most part I have been extremely disappointed until I took Jason's course. This course answered so many questions I had and gave me the tools and information I was looking for to truly upgrade the quality of my meetings. Now I know how to get people to participate instead of getting dead silence when I ask a question. I now am able to keep people's attention in my meetings and most importantly, I now lead with a powerful hook. As a result of taking Jason's course, I am closing more sales, dazzling my customers and getting rave reviews. If you are looking to dramatically increase your meeting skills, this is a must course."

Jim Facente -President Creative Sales Solutions

I actually just finished watching the Meeting presentation we've been working through at our weekly Staff Meetings. When we ask, "How can we use this in our particular ministries here?" the applications for school, growth groups, and sermon-writing and preaching are just about endless. Thank you for your insights. I'd never considered how my personality might naturally communicate better with some learners than with others. "Rule the Room" stressed the importance of knowing my own style first. Now I'm designing learning activities that capitalize on the strengths of my style, while still engaging each individual.

Phil Hunter – Pastor

“Jason Teteak's teaching not only provided easy-to-use techniques, but the confidence and presence to truly run the show and communicate to your audience what you intended to. He changed the way I think—about being in front of people and about feeling assured doing my own thing effectively. You need to see what this course can do for you!"

Mike Dyer – Project Manager

"Jason's tips and advice have been tremendously beneficial to me both professionally and personally. Not only does he have great insights into how to engage adult learners during a meeting; he also has ways for making the usually daunting task of writing meeting material more manageable and achievable in a way that benefits both the presenter and the audience. These tips are great for public speaking beyond business settings too!"

Jon Maloto – User Experience Designer
title: Meetings that Motivate: Presentations to Manage Your Meeting
